installer.title: TateLyleBatchExpert+
installer.description: Installer for ILS Automation's Batch Expert+ for Dupont Tate-Lyle

panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This is a special version of the ILS Automation installer built for update of the "Tate-Lyle" BE+ installation.

panel.title: Python Extensions for Batch Expert+
panel.preamble: This page loads the custom Python modules that support Batch Expert+.

artifact.name: ILS jar files for Batch Expert+
Custom SFC Steps for Batch Expert+

panel.title: Install Configuration Tags
panel.preamble: This page creates BatchExpert configuration tags and defines UDTs for common controllers. These definitions are written to the default tag provider.

panel.title: Create alternative Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by application tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Define the Database Connection
panel.preamble: Specify the database connection and DBMS-type that are used for BatchExpert+.

panel.title: Batch-Expert Feature Selection
panel.preamble: Configure the Batch-Expert+ installation to include the SFC and other optional features. Note that these features are record as tag values. These decisions are, therefore, easily reversed.

artifact.name: CAMPAIGN
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add campaign as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CODE
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add batch code as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CONDITION
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add condition as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: CUSTOMER
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add customer as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: EFT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add auto EFT clearance as a feature.

artifact.name: FERMENTATION
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add fermentation (organism) as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: OWNER
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add owner as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: PRODUCT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add product as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: PROJECT
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add project as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: RESOURCE
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add resource as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: SETUP
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add setup as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: SFC
artifact.comment: Enable Sequential Functional Charts (SFCs) within Batch-Expert. Use of this feature requires the Ignition SFC module and involves installation of a custom SFC module from ILS.

artifact.name: STRAIN
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add strain as a parameter for batch tracking.

artifact.name: VESSEL
artifact.comment: Configure Batch Expert+ to add vessel id as a parameter for batch tracking.

panel.title: Database Scripts for Batch Expert+ Testing
panel.preamble: This page recreates the database schema to BatchExpert+ 2.4. First drop, then create.

artifact.name: Drop Tables
artifact.comment: Clear the existing database of all tables, procedures and indices. This step is only needed if the database is to be completely re-created.

artifact.name: Create Tables
artifact.comment: Create tables and indices required for Batch Expert.

artifact.name: Populate Tables
artifact.comment: Populate tables with common choose-list entries.

panel.title: Install UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page creates the standard user-defined-tags as well as special definitions for Tate-Lyle. The definitions are written to the "default" tag provider.

panel.title: Install Custom UDT Definitions for Tate-Lyle
panel.preamble: This page creates the custom user-defined-tags for Tate-Lyle. The definitions are written to the "default" tag provider.

panel.title: Install Tag Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page creates tags corresponding to Tate-Lyle fermenters and are driven by a simulator. Do NOT use in for production. These tags are for test systems only. The definitions, like all BE tags, are written to the "default" tag provider.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs the ILS custom modules necessary for BatchExpert+ installations that include the SFC feature.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs the ILS custom modules necessary for BatchExpert+.

panel.title: Install BatchExpert+ 2.4 - Specially assembled for Dupont Tate-Lyle
panel.preamble: Create Batch Expert+ 2.4 for Dupont Tate-Lyle. This project includes Tate-Lyle-specific configurations.

artifact.name: BatchExpertTateLyle24
artifact.comment: Create a BatchExpert+ 2.4 project for Dupont Tate-Lyle.

panel.title: Install the Global Project
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of the BatchExpert global project. The basic global project contains the default alarm pipeline configuration.

artifact.name: BatchExpertGlobal
artifact.comment: Create the baseline global resources for the BatchExpert+. These consist of an alarm pipeline.

panel.title: Set Gateway Defaults
panel.preamble: Set properties in the internal database of the Gateway. In particular, named "Batch Expert" entries are made for alarm journals, alarm pipelines and smtp mail servers. The user is given gateway edit privileges. Additionally the project and provider default datasources are set. This is critical for proper operation of tags bound to databases.

panel.title: Initialize Test Project
panel.preamble: Point the unit UDT batchIDs to the latest batches.

artifact.name: Update Batch IDs
artifact.comment: Update the unit batchID values to the current batch.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of BatchExpert+ in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Installation Complete
epilog.preamble: The automated installation and configuration of Batch Expert+ is complete. There are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Newly created projects are installed disabled. They must be enabled before use.
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
